entries.title: Little Rock Central: 50 Years Later
entries.synopsis: To mark the 50th anniversary of the forced integration of Central High School, Little Rock natives Brent and Craig Renaud provide a candid look at the lives of contemporary Central High students. Filmed over the course of a year, this documentary also follows teachers, administrators and community leaders while sharing the stories of both black and white students.

entries.title: Latino Health Access: A Model of Community Action
entries.synopsis: An inside look at the inspired efforts of Latino Health Access and its dynamic founder America Bracho, MD, MPH.

entries.title: Is Weight Something We Inherit?
entries.synopsis: Renowned geneticists answer the most frequently asked questions about whether or not we inherit our weight problems.

entries.title: Indian Point: Imagining the Unimaginable
entries.synopsis: Twenty million people live within a 50-mile radius of the Indian Point Energy Center and its three nuclear reactors. This film takes a cautionary look at the possible consequences of an accident or terrorist attack on the facility--a catastrophe that could potentially render much of the Hudson River Valley and New York City uninhabitable.

entries.title: The Iceman Tapes: Conversations With a Killer
entries.synopsis: Richard Kuklinski was a devoted husband, loving father--and ruthless killer of over 100 people. You'll meet 'The Iceman' in this powerful documentary that features one of the most vivid and disturbing interviews ever recorded--taped behind the walls of the prison where Kuklinski is serving two consecutive life sentences for multiple homicide.

entries.title: The Iceman Confesses: Secrets of a Mafia Hitman
entries.synopsis: Richard Kuklinski was a devoted husband, a loving father...and a ruthless killer. A decade after HBO last visited him in prison, the convicted murderer, who freely admits having whacked more than 100 people in cold blood, takes viewers back inside his cold, calculating mind for more insights about his exploits as one of the Mafia's most notorious assassins.

entries.title: The Iceman and the Psychiatrist
entries.synopsis: For the third time, HBO cameras go inside Trenton State Maximum Security Prison--and inside the mind of one of the most prolific killers in U.S. history. Mafia hit man Richard Kuklinski freely admits to killing more than 100 people, but in this special, he speaks with top psychiatrist Dr. Park Dietz in an effort to face the truth about his condition.

entries.title: Heir To an Execution: A Granddaughter's Story
entries.synopsis: In 1953, Julius and Ethel Rosenberg were executed by the U.S. government, their names seared into history as both martyrs and atomic spies. Today, they remain political icons--hailed by some as heroes and vilified by others as traitors. This film chronicles the efforts of filmmaker Ivy Meeropol to come to terms with the lives and deaths of the Rosenbergs--her grandparents.

entries.title: Healthy Mom, Healthy Baby: The Risks of Excess Weight
entries.synopsis: Curtailing the obesity epidemic for the next generation is the focus of this documentary that offers ideas on intervention during pregnancy and early childhood.

entries.title: Hard as Nails
entries.synopsis: Justin Fatica is not for everyone. When he steps up to the altar, the unordained minister becomes a frenetic whirlwind of energy, using a mix of professional wrestling, hip hop and Scripture to bring Jesus to thousands of young worshippers. This film follows the self-ordained preacher who started his controversial 'Hard as Nails' ministry as a way to reach troubled kids.

entries.title: Habla Women
entries.synopsis: Take a uniquely Latina view of life in the United States in this no-holds-barred 10th installment in the 'Habla' series. From a newspaper CEO-publisher to an Olympic boxing medalist, and many others, this special charts the joys of challenges faced by U.S. Latinas of all ages and backgrounds.

entries.title: Habla Men
entries.synopsis: The eleventh installment of HBO Latino's acclaimed "Habla" series includes interviews with Pulitzer Prize Winning Author Junot Diaz, actor, singer and songwriter Carlos Ponce, World Heavyweight Champion Blue Demon, and more. They'll share their riveting stories and experiences as Latino men in the United States.

entries.title: Friends of God: A Road Trip With Alexandra Pelosi
entries.synopsis: HBO's intrepid reporter/tour guide Alexandra Pelosi undertakes an entertaining road trip into the red-state heartland of America for a look at the many millions of evangelical Christians--from TV celebrities like Joel Osteen and Jerry Falwell to the leaders of groups like the Christian Wrestling Federation--who have become a formidable force in our culture and our democracy.

entries.title: Dope Sick Love
entries.synopsis: Meet Matt & Tracy and Sebastian & Michelle--two New York City couples looking for love, and fixes, in all the wrong places. This candid documentary follows the drug-addicted couples as they eke out a bare-bones existence on the streets, desperately trying to score cash to pay for their next fix. The result is an unflinching look at the human need for love and escape.

entries.title: Diana, Our Mother: Her Life and Legacy
entries.synopsis: Diana, Our Mother features interviews with HRH The Duke of Cambridge and HRH Prince Harry, both of whom talk openly about their mother and pay tribute to the many ways her influence has shaped their lives.

entries.title: Dead Men Talking: An 'Autopsy' Special
entries.synopsis: The dead reveal their secrets once again in this 'Autopsy' special. Segments include: a Boy Scout leader who was freed from prison thanks to some unhatched maggot eggs; a Hitchcockian double homicide; a beloved doctor whose rapes might have gone unpunished had it not been for a persistent victim; and an algae killer used in fish tanks that plays a role in poisoning murders.

entries.title: Coma
entries.synopsis: The mystery of coma has intrigued people for decades. This film follows a year in the lives of four patients at JFK Medical Center's Center for Head Injuries--one of the top institutions for studying and rehabilitating brain-injury victims--as they emerge from their comas into a persistent vegetative state, a minimally conscious state, or something beyond.

entries.title: City Dump: The Story of the 1951 CCNY Basketball Scandal
entries.synopsis: In the late '40s, college basketball was soaring, led by the CCNY basketball team of 1949-51--an extraordinary collection of players who won both the NIT and NCAA championship titles in the same season. Then the ax fell: players had conspired with gamblers to fix games to create one of the saddest and darkest chapters in sports history.

entries.title: Celebrity Habla 2
entries.synopsis: See what celebrated Latino actors, newsmakers and a musical legend have to say about being Latino in the U.S. in this installment of the award-winning series. Interviews include Jimmy Smits, Luis Guzman, Daisy Fuentes, Wilmer Valderrama, Ana de la Reguera, Ruben Blades, Bernie Williams, and many others.

entries.title: Celebrity Habla
entries.synopsis: See what celebrated Latino actors, newsmakers and a musical legend have to say about being Latino in the U.S. in this sixth installment in the award-winning series.

entries.title: Can a Lifetime of Excess Weight Lead to Heart Disease?
entries.synopsis: Dr. Donald Lloyd-Jones delves inside cardiovascular disease, including how it begins early in life and its direct connection to weight gain.

entries.title: Brave New Voices 2010
entries.synopsis: Stand up and make yourself heard--that is the message that went out to more than 500 teenagers as they assembled in Los Angeles for the Brave New Voices 2010 National Slam team championships. Capturing all the excitement and poetry of the five-day festival, this special culminates in the Grand Slam Finals between four teams as they compete in front of a raucous audience.

entries.title: Baghdad ER
entries.synopsis: The 86th Combat Support Hospital (CSH)--the U.S. Army's premier medical facility in Iraq--is the setting for this unforgettable documentary. In addition to profiling the doctors and nurses at the 86th who fight to save wounded soldiers, the film provides vivid frontline rescue footage along with tension-filled scenes of soldiers patrolling one deadly stretch of highway.

entries.title: Babe Ruth
entries.synopsis: He was perhaps the greatest ballplayer who ever lived. A larger-than-life hero on the field, Babe Ruth's exploits off the field were just as legendary. Don't miss this compilation of rarely seen footage, home movies and revealing interviews that uncover stories not even the most devout baseball fan has ever heard.

entries.title: Autopsy 9: Dead Awakening
entries.synopsis: An entire family poisoned by an unknown intruder. A suicide made to look like a murder. An airbag that becomes a perfect crime scene. These fascinating stories and more are unveiled in this Autopsy special that looks at criminal cases that might never have been uncovered were it not for the efforts of forensic pathologists and other "detectives of death."

entries.title: Autopsy 8: Dead Giveaway
entries.synopsis: The 'detectives of death' investigate another slate of bizarre cases, including: a twisted case of sibling sabotage; a mystery where saliva turned a suicide into a homicide; the story of a convicted rapist whose claims of innocence are taken seriously when his DNA turns up on a victim while he is in jail; and a 'final answer' to the question, 'Who was the Black Widow?'

entries.title: Antes de que nos olviden (Before We Are Forgotten)
entries.synopsis: Former Mexican President Felipe Calderon's six-year war on drug trafficking is the focus of this investigative documentary. The voices of parents, siblings, wives, and children of the many victims of the war--more than 121,000 and counting--tell their personal stories of suffering.

entries.title: The Alzheimer's Project: The Memory Loss Tapes
entries.synopsis: Seven people living through various stages of Alzheimer's disease are profiled in this verite documentary. Among the emotionally gripping stories: a mother who holds fiercely to her simple lifestyle, yet recognizes that her failing memory is making it more difficult; and a woman in a nursing home who believes her reflection in the mirror is her best friend.

entries.title: The Alzheimer's Project: Momentum in Science (Part 2)
entries.synopsis: Part 2 of 2. Go inside the labs and clinics of 25 scientists and physicians leading the fight against Alzheimer's disease. Discover a real reason for optimism as these leading experts seek to find out what can be done to detect and diagnose Alzheimer's better, delay the onset of memory loss, affect the changes occurring in diseased brains, and ultimately prevent it entirely.

entries.title: The Alzheimer's Project: Momentum in Science (Part 1)
entries.synopsis: Part 1 of 2. Go inside the labs and clinics of 25 scientists and physicians leading the fight against Alzheimer's disease. Discover a real reason for optimism as these leading experts seek to find out what can be done to detect and diagnose Alzheimer's better, delay the onset of memory loss, affect the changes occurring in diseased brains, and ultimately prevent it entirely.

entries.title: The Alzheimer's Project: Grandpa, Do You Know Who I Am?
entries.synopsis: Five children--ages 6-15--talk about coping with grandparents who are suffering from Alzheimer's disease in this documentary. Maria Shriver provides commentary and delivers valuable lessons for the kids.

entries.title: The Alzheimer's Project: Caregivers
entries.synopsis: The impact of Alzheimer's disease on those who provide care to these patients is the focus in this documentary. See five moving portraits of the sacrifices and successes made by people experiencing their loved one's gradual descent into dementia.

entries.title: Agriculture
entries.synopsis: Inside the agricultural system and the challenge to increase access of healthy, affordable fruits and vegetables to all Americans.

entries.title: Pedro Capo En letra de otro
entries.synopsis: Award-winning Puerto Rican singer-songwriter Pedro Capo honors a variety of leading Latin artists he grew up with by performing a selection of their hits--songs we know and love--in his own style. This special features covers of Selena, Chayanne, Jon Secada, Jerry Rivera, Luis Miguel, Calle 13, OV7, Fey, and Donato y Estefano plus commentary from Pedro himself.

entries.title: Brillo Box (3Â¢ Off)
entries.synopsis: In 1969, Lisanne Skylerâs parents bought an Andy Warhol âBrillo Box (3Â¢ Off)â sculpture for $1,000. An exact replica of a shipping carton for Brillo soap pads, Warholâs Brillo Boxes were at first dismissed by the art world. But 40 years later, with Warholâs reputation as a contemporary-art visionary long secured, the same piece sold for more than $3 million at a record-breaking Christieâs auction.

entries.title: J Balvin: Bruuttal
entries.synopsis: Chart-topping Colombian reggaeton singer J Balvin performs in his hometown of MedellÃ­n in this exciting concert featuring an all-star lineup of special guests.

entries.title: Clinica de Migrantes: Life, Liberty and the Pursuit of Happiness
entries.synopsis: From Maxim Pozdorovkin (HBOâs Pussy Riot: A Punk Prayer), ClÃ­nica de Migrantes goes beyond the politicized rhetoric to show the faces of real people in the middle of the immigration debate, asking if America can continue withholding basic necessities from an estimated 11 million undocumented immigrants.

entries.title: The Concert for Valor
entries.synopsis: HBO and Starbucks salute U.S. veterans and their families with this live concert on the National Mall in Washington, D.C. The show will feature an array of talent from the worlds of music and entertainment, including Eminem, Jamie Foxx, Dave Grohl, Metallica, John Oliver, Rihanna, Bruce Springsteen, Tom Hanks, Steven Spielberg, Carrie Underwood and Zac Brown Band, and more.

entries.title: Spielberg
entries.synopsis: Through exclusive interviews with actors, family, and the filmmaker himself, this unprecedented documentary pulls back the curtain on the remarkable career of Steven Spielberg.

entries.title: Wishful Drinking
entries.synopsis: Hollywood icon Carrie Fisher tells her raucous, raw and intoxicating true story in this documentary based on her hit stage production.

entries.title: Rolling Stone: Stories from the Edge
entries.synopsis: A look at the last 50 years of American music, politics and pop culture through the story of Rolling Stone magazine.

entries.title: War Dog: A Soldier's Best Friend
entries.synopsis: A deeply personal film about the intimate relationship between veterans and their K9 companions, both during and after combat.

entries.title: Baltimore Rising
entries.synopsis: In the wake of Freddie Gray's death in police custody, peaceful protests and destructive riots erupted as the city awaited the fate of six police officers involved in the incident. Baltimore Rising follows activists, police officers, community leaders and gang affiliates, who struggle to hold Baltimore together.

entries.title: Rolling Stone: Stories from the Edge 02
entries.synopsis: A look at the last 50 years of American music, politics and pop culture through the story of Rolling Stone magazine.

entries.title: Meth Storm
entries.synopsis: This documentary looks at meth addiction in rural America from the perspective of dealers, users and law enforcement.

entries.title: The Newspaperman: The Life and Times of Ben Bradlee
entries.synopsis: A profile of legendary Washington Post editor Ben Bradlee who fought to publish the Pentagon Papers and later brought down Richard Nixon.

entries.title: 32 Pills: My Sisters Suicide
entries.synopsis: Follows Hope Litoff as she traces the mysterious life and tragic suicide of her sister, famed New York photographer Ruth Litoff.

entries.title: David Bowie: The Last Five Years
Happening: A Clean Energy Revolution
entries.synopsis: A look at Americans who are pioneering the use of clean energy to create jobs, turn profits, and make Americans' lives healthier.

entries.title: Agnelli
entries.synopsis: Biographical portrait of Gianni Agnelli, the legendary Italian industrialist, playboy and fashion trendsetter.

entries.title: 15: A Quinceaneras Story: Zoey
entries.synopsis: With the help of her trans-madrinas (godmothers), 15-year-old Zoey prepares for her quinceanera.

entries.title: 15: A Quinceaneras Story: Rosi
entries.synopsis: As an American with a mother from Guatemala and a father from Cuba, Rosi combines all three cultures for a quinceanera in Havana.

entries.title: 15: A Quinceaneras Story: Ashley
entries.synopsis: As Ashley prepares for a boxing match and her quinceanera, she must deal with pressure her family feels due to their immigration status.

entries.title: 15: A Quinceaneras Story: Jackie & Nina
entries.synopsis: Best friends from San Antonio, Texas, Jackie and Nina celebrate their Mexican heritage and a joint-quinceanera through the Mexican rodeo.

entries.title: Michigan vs. Ohio State: The Rivalry
entries.synopsis: One of the greatest rivalries in all of sports--Michigan vs. Ohio State in college football--is examined in this documentary.

entries.title: The Number on Great-Grandpa's Arm
entries.synopsis: An American boy and his great-grandfather, an Auschwitz survivor, share a conversation in this inspirational film.

entries.title: May It Last: A Portrait of the Avett Brothers
entries.synopsis: Follow the story of the North Carolina brothers Scott and Seth Avett--founders of the indie folk-rock band The Avett Brothers.

entries.title: Good Hair
entries.synopsis: Chris Rock seeks the answer to his young daughter's question about African-American hair in this documentary.

entries.title: The Zen Diaries of Garry Shandling
Arthur Miller: Writer
entries.synopsis: An intimate portrait of legendary playwright Arthur Miller as told from the unique perspective of his daughter, Rebecca.

entries.title: I Am Evidence
entries.synopsis: A timely exploration into why hundreds of thousands of untested rape kits are ignored in the U.S.

entries.title: The Zen Diaries of Garry Shandling Part 2
entries.synopsis: Late comedy legend Garry Shandling is remembered in this revealing two-part documentary from Judd Apatow.

entries.title: King in the Wilderness
entries.synopsis: Through personal stories of the people who were around him, this film follows Martin Luther King, Jr. during the last years of his life.

entries.title: Elvis Presley: The Searcher - Part 2
entries.synopsis: Experience the King as you've never seen him before in this two-part documentary that focuses on Elvis Presley the musical artist.

entries.title: Billie Jean King: Portrait of a Pioneer
entries.synopsis: A profile of the remarkable life and career of tennis legend Billie Jean King, both on and off the court.

entries.title: Being Serena 01
entries.synopsis: Serena Williams discovers she is pregnant before capturing her 23rd Grand Slam singles title at the 2017 Australian Open.

entries.title: A Dangerous Son
entries.synopsis: This film focuses on three families with a child who has a serious mental illness, and the struggles of each to find appropriate treatment.

entries.title: 2018 Rock and Roll Hall of Fame Induction Ceremony
entries.synopsis: Recorded live, this special honors fivenew performer category inductees: Bon Jovi, The Cars, Nina Simone, The Moody Blues and Dire Straits.

entries.title: Being Serena 02
entries.synopsis: Each edition of this five-part series will chronicle tennis icon Serena Williams at pivotal moments in her life during 2017 and 2018.

entries.title: Being Serena 03
entries.synopsis: Each edition of this five-part series will chronicle tennis icon Serena Williams at pivotal moments in her life during 2017 and 2018.

entries.title: Being Serena 04
entries.synopsis: Each edition of this five-part series will chronicle tennis icon Serena Williams at pivotal moments in her life during 2017 and 2018.

entries.title: John McCain: For Whom The Bell Tolls
entries.synopsis: Explore the life of Sen. John McCain in this illuminating profile of one of the most influential forces in modern American politics.

entries.title: Being Serena 05
entries.synopsis: Each edition of this five-part series will chronicle tennis icon Serena Williams at pivotal moments in her life during 2017 and 2018.

entries.title: Bobby Kennedy: In His Own Words
entries.synopsis: Unique documentary of one of America's most revered politicians, Robert F. Kennedy.

entries.title: It Will Be Chaos
entries.synopsis: An inside look at the human consequences of the migration crisis that unfolded between Italy and the Balkan corridor

entries.title: Capturing the Friedmans
entries.synopsis: A riveting look at a family's disintegration amidst the turmoil of the father and youngest son being charged with child molestation.

entries.title: Pete Holmes: Faces and Sounds
entries.synopsis: Comedian/writer/actor Pete Holmes shares his hilarious insights into life's most absurd moments in this stand-up comedy special.
